carve.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to make an object or pattern by cutting a piece of wood or stone
carve.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a statue carved from a single block of marble
carve.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to cut a pattern or letter on the surface of something
carve.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Someone had carved their initials on the tree.
carve.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to cut a large piece of cooked meat into smaller pieces using a knife
carve.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to succeed in getting the job, position, life etc that you want
carve.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: He carved a niche for himself as a writer.
She carved out a successful career in the film industry.
He moved to Boston to carve out a new life for himself.
carve.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if a river, the wind etc carves land or rock, it removes some of it
carve.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The river had carved channels in the limestone rock.
carve.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to reduce the size of something by removing some of it
carve.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The company carved $1 million from its budget.
